metadata.name: badgeVariants
metadata.description:
A class-variance-authority (cva) configuration that defines the styling variants for the Badge component. It includes a base style with rounded corners, padding, and focus states, along with four variants:
- default: Primary colored background with hover effect
- secondary: Secondary colored background with hover effect
- destructive: Destructive colored background with hover effect
- outline: Simple outlined style
Each variant has specific color, background, and hover state styling. The default variant is set to 'default'.

metadata.name: BadgeProps
metadata.description: Interface that defines the props for the Badge component. It extends React.HTMLAttributes<HTMLDivElement> to include all standard HTML div attributes and adds VariantProps from the badgeVariants configuration. This allows the Badge component to accept both standard HTML attributes and specific variant properties for styling.

definition.name: Badge
definition.description: A versatile badge component that displays small bits of information. It supports different visual variants and can be customized through className props. The badge is rendered as a div element with configurable styles.

className.description: Additional CSS classes to apply to the badge

variant.description: The visual style variant of the badge

properties.description: Extends HTMLDivElement attributes and includes variant props

definition.visualLayout: A small, rounded container with text inside. The appearance changes based on the variant prop, affecting background color, text color, and border styles.
